column1: chili~/ˈtʃɪli/: a small hot-tasting pod of a variety of capsicum
column4: and spice powders~I added some chili to the soup to give it a bit of a kick.

column1: chip~ /tʃɪp/: a thin slice of food (typically potato) made crisp by being fried
column3: or dried and eaten as a snack~Would you like some chips with your sandwich?

column1: curry~ /ˈkʌri/: a dish of meat
column4: cooked in an Indian-style sauce of strong spices and typically served with rice~We had chicken curry for dinner last night.

column1: onion~ /ˈʌnjən/: an edible bulb with a pungent taste and smell
column3: used in cooking~Chop the onion finely before adding it to the pan.

column1: grill~ /ɡrɪl/: a device on a cooker that radiates heat downwards for cooking food~We decided to grill some burgers for lunch.
meat~ /miːt/: the flesh of an animal (especially a mammal) as food~She doesn't eat meat
noodles~ /ˈnuːdlz/: a very thin
column2: long strip of pasta or a similar flour paste
column3: eaten with a sauce or in a soup~I made a bowl of chicken noodle soup.

column1: omelette~ /ˈɒmlɪt/: a dish of beaten eggs cooked in a frying pan and served plain or with a savoury or sweet topping or filling~He made a cheese omelette for breakfast.
pancake~ /ˈpænkeɪk/: a thin
column3: fried on both sides in a pan and typically rolled up with a sweet or savoury filling~We had pancakes with maple syrup for breakfast.

column1: seafood~ /ˈsiːfuːd/: shellfish and sea fish
column2: served as food~The restaurant is famous for its fresh seafood.

column1: sweet~ /swiːt/: having the pleasant taste characteristic of sugar or honey; not salty
column3: or bitter~She prefers sweet desserts over savory ones.

column1: below~ /bɪˈləʊ/: at a lower level or layer~The temperature dropped below freezing last night.
cave~ /keɪv/: a large underground chamber
column3: in a hillside or cliff~We explored a dark cave during our hike.

column1: cloud~ /klaʊd/: a visible mass of condensed watery vapour floating in the atmosphere
column2: typically high above the general level of the ground~The sky was covered with dark clouds.

column1: countryside~ /ˈkʌntrisaɪd/: the land and scenery of a rural area~They moved to the countryside to enjoy a quieter life.
dirt~ /dɜːt/: a substance
column3: that soils someone or something~The kids came home covered in dirt after playing outside.

column1: fog~ /fɒɡ/: a thick cloud of tiny water droplets suspended in the atmosphere at or near the earth's surface which obscures or restricts visibility~Driving in the fog can be very dangerous.
gas~ /ɡæs/: an air-like fluid substance which expands freely to fill any space available
column2: irrespective of its quantity~We need to refill the gas tank before our trip.

column1: hike~ /haɪk/: a long walk
column2: especially in the country or wilderness~We went for a hike in the mountains last weekend.

column1: lightning~ /ˈlaɪtnɪŋ/: the occurrence of a natural electrical discharge of very short duration and high voltage between a cloud and the ground or within a cloud~The storm brought heavy rain and lightning.
place~ /pleɪs/: a particular position
column3: or area in space; a location~This is a nice place to have a picnic.

column1: seed~ /siːd/: the unit of reproduction of a flowering plant
column2: capable of developing into another such plant~We planted some seeds in the garden.

column1: snake~ /sneɪk/: a long limbless reptile which has no eyelids
column3: and jaws that are capable of considerable extension~We saw a snake slithering through the grass.

column1: snow~ /snəʊ/: atmospheric water vapour frozen into ice crystals and falling in light white flakes or lying on the ground as a white layer~The children were excited to see the snow falling.
steam~ /stiːm/: the vapour into which water is converted when heated
column2: forming a white mist of minute water droplets in the air~The steam from the boiling water fogged up the windows.

column1: sunset~ /ˈsʌnˌsɛt/: the time in the evening when the sun disappears below the horizon~We watched the beautiful sunset from the beach.
sunshine~ /ˈsʌnʃaɪn/: direct sunlight unbroken by cloud
column2: especially over a comparatively large area~The weather forecast predicts sunshine for the weekend.

column1: temperature~ /ˈtɛmprɪtʃə/: the degree or intensity of heat present in a substance or object~The temperature dropped significantly overnight.
thunder~ /ˈθʌndə/: a loud rumbling or crashing noise heard after a lightning flash due to the expansion of rapidly heated air~The thunder scared the dog.
wind~ /wɪnd/: the perceptible natural movement of the air
column2: especially in the form of a current of air blowing from a particular direction~The wind was so strong it knocked over the trash cans.
